Those stairs on the right are those I use to get up to the ABC News office. I was the only one to show up and decided to leave a couple of hours later when the water around the building rose further.

I was nowhere near the river or and flood plain last night and woke up to the first sunshine we’ve had in weeks so I decided to go on my regular Wednesday morning ride. It was obvious pretty quickly that wasn’t going to happen so I just rode around the city and the river taking a few photos before heading to work.

The city is in pandemonium with some streets totally deserted and others full of people and cars. Bicycle is definitely the best way to get around in a situation like this. The whole thing feels surreal and it’s very difficult to gauge the seriousness of it.
